bugs.title: [abrt] bottles: GFX9_3DSTATE_CONSTANT_VS_pack(): python3.11 killed by SIGSEGV

bugzilla.short_desc: [abrt] bottles: GFX9_3DSTATE_CONSTANT_VS_pack(): python3.11 killed by SIGSEGV

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Summary: Bottle app crashes during setup on Fedora Rawhide

Description: I installed Bottle from GNOME Software on Fedora Rawhide. I opened it and followed the steps to create a bottle. When it got to the last step where it configures the bottle, it crashed and showed an error message saying "gome software". I tried to reopen the app but it crashed again.

Steps for reproduction:

Install the Bottle app from GNOME Software on Fedora Rawhide
Open the Bottle app and click "Create New Bottle"
Choose a name, icon and runner for the bottle
Click "Create" and wait for the setup process
Notice the crash and error message
Expected Results: The bottle is created and configured successfully but this does not happen.

Actual Results: The app crashes and shows an error message saying "gnome software".

Additional info: I'm using Fedora Rawhide https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/fedora/linux/development/rawhide/Workstation/x86_64/iso/ with gnome 44.beta

Please let me know if you need more information or the logs.

Version-Release number of selected component:
bottles-2022.7.14-3.fc38

Additional info:
reporter:       libreport-2.17.7
type:           CCpp
reason:         python3.11 killed by SIGSEGV

Created attachment 1946507
File: backtrace

Hello,

I ran into a problem installing Bottle from Gnome Software on Fedora Rawhide. When I reached the last step to configure the application, the application crashed and gave me an error message. I tried to repeat the same step, but the application crashed again.

I have created a bug report for this issue on Bugzilla. I hope that the developers can solve this problem as soon as possible, because I want to use the Bottle application.

Thank you!

Thanks for the bug report. We are currently working on getting an up to date release of Bottles packaged for Fedora. Unfortunately, what's in the repo now is outdated.

Since you are running rawhide, could you try the build from Copr [1]? No guarantees, though. I haven't found the time yet testing it myself. You can enable the Copr repo with 'dnf copr enable gui1ty/bottles'.

[1] https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/gui1ty/bottles/
FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb has been submitted as an update to Fedora 38. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb

FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb has been pushed to the Fedora 38 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb has been pushed to the Fedora 38 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: [abrt] bottles: create_bottle(): new.py:196:create_bottle:IndexError: list index out of range

bugzilla.short_desc: [abrt] bottles: create_bottle(): new.py:196:create_bottle:IndexError: list index out of range

long_desc.thetext:

Tried creating a bottle with no title on Fedora 38 beta

Version-Release number of selected component:
bottles-2022.7.14-3.fc38

Additional info:

comment:        Try to create a bottle in the GUI on Fedora 38 beta

Thanks for the bug report. Unfortunately, Bottles in Fedora is currently in an unusable state. We are working on getting it updated to the latest release, but not all dependencies required for that have yet made it into the Fedora repos.

You could help us out by installing the test build from Copr (https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/gui1ty/bottles/). I haven't tried it yet myself. It may not work at all. Alternatively, you can install Bottles from FlatHub, which is provided by upstream.

I just created a gaming bottle (first bottle) and a message appeared that gnome crashed.


reporter:       libreport-2.17.9
kernel:         6.2.11-300.fc38.x86_64
cmdline:        /usr/bin/python3 /usr/bin/bottles
cgroup:         0::/user.slice/user-1000.slice/user@1000.service/app.slice/app-flatpak-com.github.eneshecan.WhatsAppForLinux-2747.scope
uid:            1000
reason:         new.py:196:create_bottle:IndexError: list index out of range
executable:     /usr/bin/bottles
type:           Python3
package:        bottles-2022.7.14-3.fc38
runlevel:       N 5
exception_type: IndexError
crash_function: create_bottle
interpreter:    python3-3.11.2-1.fc38.x86_64
comment:        I just created a gaming bottle (first bottle) and a message appeared that gnome crashed.

I/we hope to be able to push an updated Bottles package shortly [1]. In the meantime, you could try the preliminary package and dependencies from Copr:

sudo dnf copr enable gui1ty/bottles
sudo dnf --refresh --enablerepo=updates-testing upgrade bottles

I would appreciate some feedback on that package.

[1] currently waiting on two dependencies to be reviewed

FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb has been submitted as an update to Fedora 38. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb

To all reporters, thank you for taking the time to report bugs. Once the update is pushed to testing, there will be a comment in this bug explaining how to install from the testing repo. If you could do so and test the update to see if that fixes the issues you have been experiencing, that would be very much appreciated. Please also leave karma on the update according to your testing results.

Thank you for your patience!

FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb has been pushed to the Fedora 38 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

1. install Bottles
 sudo dnf install bottles
2. Run through the first time setup
3. Create a new Bottle

long_desc.thetext:

installed bottles using DNF. After starting it (before and after a laptop-restart) the bottles-symbol says, there might not be an internet connection (which factual is, else this report would not be online). When clicking "create a new bottle", this error pops up. 

Version-Release number of selected component:
bottles-2022.7.14-3.fc38

Thanks for the bug report. Unfortunately, Bottles in Fedora is currently in an unusable state. We are working on getting it updated to the latest release, but not all dependencies required for that have yet made it into the Fedora repos.

You could help us out by installing the test build from Copr (https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/gui1ty/bottles/). I haven't tried it yet myself. It may not work at all. Alternatively, you can install Bottles from FlatHub, which is provided by upstream.

Near-Immedate non-fatal error.

1. Install Bottles from Feodra Linux source from GNOME Software
2. Start it in any way either from GNOME Software or from GNOME Application menu
3. Click through the welcome pop-up, clicking the 'Continue' button in the 3rd screen.
4. Get the ABRT notification, application is "working" but refuses to do anything.

sudo dnf copr enable gui1ty/bottles
sudo dnf --refresh upgrade bottles

I would appreciate some feedback on that package.

[1] currently waiting on one dependencies to be reviewed

I just started the program and went through the process of initializing the software.  At the end it said that it failed to initialized.  

The onlything I have open is Brave browser and I am watching crunchyroll .  I don't think that has anything to do with the failure. 

Thank you,

The Rejected Wolf

To all reporters, thank you for taking the time to report bugs. Once the update is pushed to testing, there will be a comment in this bug explaining how to install from the testing repo. If you could do so and test the update to see if that fixes the issues you have been experiencing, that would be very much appreciated. Please also leave karma on the update according to your testing results.

Thank you for your patience!

FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb has been pushed to the Fedora 38 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

> I use Bottle (rpm/dnf) on Fedora.
> What things can cause error?
> Python3?

There's an update for Bottles currently in testing. Please see comment 15 on how to install and test it. Or you can wait for the update to be pushed to stable in about a week.

FEDORA-2023-cc571303eb has been pushed to the Fedora 38 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

Bottles before 51.0 mishandles YAML load, which allows remote code execution via a crafted file.

Description of the problem from the github page:
The vulnerability arises from multiple potential exploitation vectors related to the YAML load function.
The most probable method of exploitation is through the importation of a carefully crafted YAML file. This file can take the form of an archive tarball, a YAML configuration file, or a custom environment recipe.
Additionally, there is a risk of remote code execution when an attacker gains control over the repository mirror.

Created bottles tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2210445]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

FEDORA-2023-328397d034 has been pushed to the Fedora 37 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2210444,2210445

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:
